name: places/ChIJj-OiJStZwokRxZShYsE9ev0
formattedAddress: 252 B E 77th St, New York, NY 10075, USA
adrFormatAddress: 252 B E 77th St, New York, NY 10075, USA

originalText.text: I’m sad they are no longer vegan. It leaves a void to be filled in the area in terms of options. It was super nice being able to go somewhere with a full menu up for grabs. The place is cozy, and has good WiFi. They are also pup friendly - I was outside early one day (was craving their pastries when they were still vegan to my knowledge) and one of their employees brought water out for my dog before they even opened! I’ve tried several of their menu options and most enjoyed the pastries, biscuits and gravy, and lavender latte when they were still vegan (though the vegan empanadas, cheesecake, soup and grilled cheese would also get good marks!). I will likely go someplace closer to home now since the number of vegan-friendly options are similar to others. If they were to return to a vegan menu I would certainly return!

originalText.text:
I am so happy I accidentally found this gem. It's on off street and it's hard to see. What a very cute designed cafe with variety of coffee, tea and Coco! The interior of the cafe is super trendy. Outdoor seating is very nice and big. It's not too crowded during weekdays which is very nice.
I tried the tea and hot coco. They were amazing. My friend ordered lavender latte and said it was the best superb! We will become regular for sure and come back weekly.

originalText.text:
Positives: Beautiful space and great chocolate chip cookie. Breakfast sandwich is JUST OK.

Negatives: Worst latte I have ever had in my life. I drink two lattes a day.

I dined in and had no idea I’d get a regular glass which was fine, but I literally got a glass of milk!!!

There was hardly any espresso in it and I could not taste the vanilla I paid for. It tasted like pure almond milk.

My friend who was with me also got an almond milk latte (in a to go cup). Her’s was visibly several shades darker and looked like she actually got espresso.

I ended up going down the block to Handcraft Coffee and buying an iced latte literally right after I left this place. That actually tasted like I was drinking espresso.

This was a huge disappointment. Specially considering I was the first client in and ordered when there was no body else there!!

Great cookie but there is no chance I’m spending anymore money at this place.

$7 + for the worse latte of your life. PS they charge for Ice.

originalText.text: Very cute all vegan place with tons of meal options. The pastries are super good, tried the cookie cheesecake, donuts, cookies and buttermilk Parmesan biscuit (was my favorite!) as far as lunch goes, had the blt and the tuna sandwich and while the fillings were tasty the bread was too dry and it made the sandwich difficult to eat.

originalText.text: Favorite coffee on the UES! Cute cafe with wifi and so many seating options both indoors and outdoors with lots of breakfast and coffee choices. Don’t skip out on the lavender latte!
